Milestone 2 - Beckn Protocol - Specifica.Statement: In this milestone, you will embark on a journey to understand the intricacies of the Beckn Protocol Specification & Architecture. This exploration will include studying the foundational layers of the protocol, such as the Core APIs, Core schema, Domain taxonomy, Communication protocol, and Authentication and Smart Contracts. These components are essential for any platform wishing to be part of the Beckn open network. Learners will delve into the details of the Transaction Layer, where the interactions between Beckn Application Platforms (BAPs), Beckn Provider Platforms (BPPs), and Beckn Gateways (BGs) are choreographed to provide a seamless transaction experience. BAPs are consumer-facing entities that initiate transactions, while BPPs fulfill them by providing services or goods. BGs facilitate the discovery and interaction between BAPs and BPPs, enhancing the network's efficiency. Understanding the roles of these entities will be crucial for grasping the network's functionality. Furthermore, the Registry Infrastructure Layer will be covered, highlighting the importance of open registries that store detailed information about network participants and the process of becoming a recognized subscriber within the network
Learning Competencies: Comprehend the purpose and structure of the Core APIs, Core schema, and Domain taxonomy.
Understand the Communication protocol and its role in integrating platforms into the Beckn network.
Identify the process and significance of Authentication and Smart Contracts within the network.
Recognize the different types of platforms within the Transaction Layer and their roles in facilitating commerce.
Describe the Registry Infrastructure and the process for platforms to become registered and trusted entities on the network.
Releases: Introductory Overview: Start with a video and reading materials that introduce the concept of the Beckn Protocol and its aims within open networks.

Core Components Breakdown: Break down the Core APIs, Core schema, Domain taxonomy, Communication protocol, and Authentication and Smart Contracts, using non-technical language to explain their functions.
Transaction Layer Analysis: An in-depth look at the Transaction Layer focusing on the roles and interactions between BAPs, BPPs, and BGs.
Registry Infrastructure Exploration: Explore the Registry Infrastructure, understanding the process of registration and the significance of the subscriber status.
Skills: Analytical Skills: Ability to break down complex protocol specifications into understandable components.
Conceptual Understanding: Grasping the high-level architecture and its impact on commerce transactions within an open network.
Critical Thinking: Evaluating the implications of the Beckn Protocol's design on different stakeholders in the network.
Communication: Articulating the workings of the Beckn Protocol and its layers in a clear, non-technical manner.
